anime.description: Days have past and past from the age of wars. Zoids Battle becomes sports, and players are called warriors. Both Imperial Force and Republice Force try to capture Zoid as a weapon, and three children protect it from unsympathetic adults.Source: AnimeNfoNote: Zoids New Century takes place 4000 years after classic Zoids.

category.name: Earth
category.description: The Earth is the third planet from the Sun. It is a ball of hot mud, but on the surface it`s cold enough, so most of us live on it (or are supposed to). To its inhabitants, our planet is their home, so, as a species, we cherish it to the point many cultures even to this day deify it. The Earth is the main setting of most fiction, but many titles are set in other places, such as unrelated fantasy worlds, and in a considerable number of fictional titles the Earth is actually destroyed by invaders.

character.name: Bit Cloud
character.description: Bit cloud is a traveling junk dealer who stumbled onto a battle and ended up becoming the miracle pilot of the blitz team. Bit is arrogant and enjoys a good Zoid battle. When his friends are in danger however, you will find Bit there, ready to help. Bit may seem to be a good for nothing to certain characters (Leena), but his true potential lies with Liger Zero. A mysterious zoid that goes berserk when anyone other than Bit attempts to pilot him.

character.name: Rinon Torosu
character.description: On the battlefield, Leena`s fighting style centers on one simple philosophy: shoot, shoot, shoot. Originally piloting a heavily-armed Dibison, she trades it in for a very customized Gun Sniper. Rather than using it in its traditional long-range role, she fits a Weasel Unit onto it, loading it with a massive number of missile launchers. Good thing. Her usual solution to a problem situation is to order Total Assault: firing everything she`s got.

character.name: Ballade Hunter
character.description: Brad originally pilots the reliable Command Wolf, but when it`s damanged beyond repair, he begins to follow a calling in his heart. Leaving the Blitz Team briefly, he seeks out a calling (like Bit) for a Zoid he could personally bond with, one he saw one time. He found that Zoid in Dr. Layon`s laboratory: the experimental Shadow Fox. With sheer bravado, he makes his way into the cockpit, climbs in, and takes off. Quickly figuring out its numerous capabilities, he easily handles the Backdraft`s pursuit, primpting Dr. Layon to make him an offer

character.name: Rion Torosu
character.description: Leon was the leader until Bit`s Truck tripped his Shield Liger, breaking Leon`s arm. Bit took over Leon`s position after Leon left the base. Leon traveled around the world, competing in battles, days bad and good. He left carcasses of trashed Zoids behind him every day until he found a Red Blade Liger or vice versa.

character.name: Jiemi Hemerosu
character.description: He only piloted the Pteras (pronounced "terrace") in the first half of the season, because Doc, our impulse shopper, traded it off on a Raynos after the Pteras was rendered unpilotable by the Backdraft`s Zabat. When he was piloting the Reynos, he entered a subconscious state and actually started being a man, instead of a kid. He`s learning to grow, but he isn`t there yet.

character.name: Dr. Torosu
character.description: Dr. Toros is the one that built the Jager, Schneider, and Panzer units for the Liger Zero. Aside from that, he is also the biggest impulse shopper within an 8 mile radius of the Toros Base, and yes, he is the father of Leena and Leon Toros.

character.name: Blitz Team
character.description: The team lead by Dr. Torosu, consisting of; Rinon, Rion, Bit, Ballade, and Jiemi.
